Reviews.Title: “Average with very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as we were traveling through Europe. The location was a bit outside of Berlin, but we didn't mind seeing some of the outer parts of the city. The train station is a good 10 minutes walk away, but there's plenty of grocery markets, restaurants and shops along the way. The service and room were average, but the breakfast buffet was an excellent spread of everything hot and cold you could wish for. I'd stay here if the price was right again and city convenience wasn't a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Mostly horrible staff, NOT 4*”
Reviews.Author: TechRoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 nights in the holiday inn garden court in Berlin. I was traveling with a friend and didn't care much about the room, mostly cared about price and location. As far as location goes, this is a good hotel, as far is price, you get what you pay for or less. This hotel is advertised as a 4 star facility and is priced as a 3 star facility. It is more like a bare minimum 3 star facility than anything else. I mean, there was a plaque with Ice cream pricing in the elevator, hardly classy. There is no restaurant, only break fest. Not to mention room service. The lobby bar is serviced by the same person at the front desk. They are not always friendly, sometimes very rood. 1 thing was horrible during our stay. The WiFi access is 12.5Euros a night if you take it for 7nights or more (I don't remember how much the price was for just 2-3 nights but obviously even more than this insane price). I have an internet based company and had to be online most of the time, I had to pay this insane charge. The problem is, that even though the price was horrible the internet connection was even worse. First 2-3 nights it was decent. Not great, decent. Later on it got worse and worse. When I told the front desk about it they said that they are aware of the problem and its because we are on the top (5th) floor. When I told them that its unacceptable that the internet keeps disconnecting even though I am paying an insane price, they gave me a 25Euro discount for the entire package. That was ok, I guess, but the internet connection got even worse and the last day I couldn't even connect at all. The night before checkout I spoke with the only decent employee and he understood the issue, he said that he will leave a message for the front desk manager and she will take care of the issue (I was expecting a full refund of the charge). The next morning (check out time) The front desk manager was extremely rood, called me a liar to my face in front of my friend, and a family friend that came to pick us up, and didn't even give me the 25Euro discount that her employees promised 2 days earlier! I was outraged and furious to the point of blurred vision. I cannot recommend this establishment and I am very, disappointed and very surprised at the holiday inn franchise, they are usually very good as far as service goes.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback following vist”
Reviews.Author: Manics
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the above hotel for 4 days at the end of November 2011. The location is excellent - situated in a quiet side street off the main Kurfurstendam but within easy reach of all tourist attractions, sights of historical interest and all transportation (including the 109 bus to Tegal Airport). The rates are comparable with other hotels, the staff were very courteous and extremely helpful and I would recommend this hotel for the Berlin tourist

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: JJ16
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this hotel a 1.5 rating if I could. My boyfriend and I wanted to set up shop at a hotel in Berlin to finish out the end of our vacation. We specifically chose this hotel because it advertised that guests could rent movies in their room if desired (English movies specifically). I also called to confirm that they had English movies before I booked the hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel and getting our room, we attempted to order movies on two out of the three movie channels (the third channel option was the porn channel). The movie system wasn't working properly so we called the front desk to see if they could help. It was obvious that the front desk wasn't enthused that we asked for help, but, nonetheless, someone was sent up to our room. When the employee arrived in our room, he tried to get the movie channels to work and was unsucessful. The porn station was working, however, and the employee let us know that this channel was still an option. Being with my boyfriend, of course, I was a bit offended by this suggestion as the last thing I was planning on doing in Berlin was watching porn. We checked later with the front desk and a female employee informed us that an electrician would be fixing the tv the next day. The following evening, the movie stations still weren't working properly. I went downstairs to check with the front desk and the same female employee told me that the the electrician was "coming tomorrow." I also inquired about the German to English toggle switch that exisisted on the TV and the employee informed me that this function never worked to begin with. I was definately annoyed at this point. I understand that we were in Germany and we shouldn't expect that everything on TV or the movies will be in English. However, I thought it was false advertising that we could watch English movies. It's a good location, but you can probably find a hotel with better amenities for a better price. I wouldn't recommend it and I'm sure the porn channel is still working just fine. It's not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookerBelfast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine if you accept that is is really all about the location . The rooms are small but fine as it is just a place to sleep. The beds are comfortable . TV is small and one thing that could be improved is the addition of tea/coffee making equipment. The bathroom is ok , shower & bath with plenty of hot water. The bar and reception area is quite small but it has drinks available if you want . It is close by the main street Kurfurstendam and there is a bus stop at the end of the street 100 m away. The staff are pleasent and very helpful. The rooms are kept clean . The breakfast is good but a bit expensive at 12 euros . All in all a good place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel, nice staff- what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: amiroi
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our vacation in berlin and we found the hotel through the reviews here. hotel's location is wonderful, just at the middle of the kurfurstdnamm, the main shopping and restaurants street of berlin but inside you don't here any noise. you can find 3 kind of transportation in a 2 minutes radius from the hotel- a bus, u bahn and s bahn- all arrives every 5 minutes approx. and takes you easily to wherever you wish in berlin. the rooms are just right! a king size bed, you can choose a pillow from a pillow menu, bathroom is a little small but really satisfactory, a couch, big desk and air conditioning. i think that the little things makes the hotel and in this hotel there were few - when we arrived late at night in the first day we found some haribo sheeps (gummy swits) on our pillow to help us full asleep, when we had rain the front desk gave us umbrellas, we bought our "city tour card" at the fromt desk and they were very helpful with all our questions about the city and transportation, restaurants in the area and everything. the breakfast was just fine! it is true that it was basicly the same everyday (vegetables, eggs, fine bread, cream cheese, yougorts, jams,bacon, all kind of fine cheese and so on) but i find it varied enough and there was a little twist every day. for the one who reviewd here before about the towels not being changed- it is very common in a lot of green european countries that if you leave your towel on the hanger it's a sign for the cleaning not to change it from a green perspective of saving water, electricity and so on. the rooms, bathrooms and the hotel at all are very clean, the room and bathroom were cleaned everyday as in every normal hotel. to sum it up - it is a great hotel that doesn't gives you the filling of a chain hotel (holiday inn) in the good sense of it. if i will ever be in berlin again i would love to saty in it again and i absolutely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel ! Terrible for business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at Holiday Inn GC Kurfurstendamm. From the moment I arrived to this place I wanted to leave, but the rate I got (not even cheap at all) did not allow cancellation so I stayed. If I had to find a positive side to this place it would be the location, very close to main shopping areas and restaurants. Metro is 1Km away. Apart from that, I found this hotel disgusting. The hotel is small, with a ridiculously small bar and lobby area. My room was smelly, with dirty carpet, old windows and doors. Small TV. Old bathroom, not pristine clean. Room doors still open with those big keys as in old hotels, no access cards. My room was in the ground floor with a small neglected backyard full of rubbish. I had to ask the staff several times before they removed the rubbish in front of my window, so it stayed there a few days. I have seen several bugs on the walls or on my bed during my stay. I paid 12.50€ per day to use the wifi connection. It is definitely overpriced, and on top of that the connection goes down every 5 minutes to ask for user login again, making it impossible to work or browse the internet normally. Also, there was no electric plug close to my bed so I could not recharge my phone and laptop while using them from the bed. There is no tea/coffee facility in the room. I had a coffee at the lobby bar once and I was charged 2.60€ for a small plastic cup of coffee that tasted like soap. I did not find the staff remarkably friendly, when I asked for information it was provided to me but rather looked as a favour... So definitely, every day, when seeing the 4-star sign at the hotel entrance, I just wondered how such a disgusting place could deserve it...

Reviews.Title: “Location great but ....”
Reviews.Author: Jenstheami
Reviews.Content: I like the location from the Hotel. Rooms are O.K. Small TV. Breakfeast is way to exspensvie, go out side the Hotel and enjoy Breakfeast in the local restaurant or Bakerey. Less exspensive and way more fun. Staff is Young and very friendly in the Hotel. No free Internet, only in the Lobby, but you dont have any privacy and there is no printer connected.

Reviews.Title: “A Great, perfectly located, little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tri_man_UK
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. A great area to stay, off the main street but very close to some nice restaurants and not far to the zoo etc. The hotel was compact, rooms adequate with a better than standard breakfast. The main reason that makes this hotel stand out other than the location, is the unbelieveable staff. From the reception staff to the breakfast waiting staff, everyone was smiley and incredibly helpful. i must mention Julietta, who spent hours trying to track down my colleauges lost luggage, always with a smile. I would stay here again next time I am in Berlin without any question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: marypatWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: A very nice small hotel in a wonderful location, near every amenity and a short bus trip from Tegal Airport. Clean and comfortable, with a friendly and accomodating staff. You cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatashaClaire1980
Reviews.Content: Very old and jaded hotel.had room over the car park, bins emptied very noisly around 6.30am every morning.Room very sml,draughty room,old wooden windows and flithy windows.Would not use again.Not a 4 star.Not up to standard for a Holiday Inn.very disappointed with this place.Only good side was the food,and it was clean.Staff all excellent, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old worn down and charged 150% of actual price!”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: Found quite a good deal on the internet including breakfast so booked one night for a few colleages and me. Six rooms in total. Hotel turned out to be rather old and shabby looking from the outside. Rooms similarly old and worn. Bathrooms were OK as were the beds and the general service. Breakfast was alright. BUT ALL IN ALL DEFINATELY NOT 4 STAR! Main point of criticism happened at the time of booking though. As I said, I had found quite a good rate - prepaid. However, I quickly realized that the hotel had charged my credit card with 150% of the amount of my reservation confirmation. I had to call at least four times over the course of more than a week, never being called back as promissed, before the issue was resolved and the excess amount was wired back to my credit card. No real apology ever came forward. Really poor service and the main reason I can absolutely not recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, shabby, Poor, overpriced,”
Reviews.Author: Mewife2kids
Reviews.Content: Nothing really bad to say about this hotel, its just not up to usual holiday Inn standards, rooms are basic, shower is small, no views etc> its in need of a refurb. Its looking old and tired I have stayed in a 4 star hotel in Berlin once a year for the last few years and this is the worst that I have stayed in. Its ok if you have booked or need a room at short notice, however you can get better hotels for you money, worth shopping around etc. Wifi stopped working at peak times which was not good for business traveller. Its about 6 euros in a cab from main train station,

Reviews.Title: “Attention! They have expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: enricarchivell
Reviews.Content: The information of the hotel clearly suggests they have free internet included in the room price, but it is not! They want to charge a ridiculuous ammount of money (5 € half an hour, or 12, 5 €) for a service which is free in many other hotes in Berlin (like the Sorat or the President, with a similar or even smaller category). So take this into account if you have internet needs!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsfitzireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by english speaking staff at the info office in berlin main train station. we were extremelly disappointed when we arrived. we barely managed to fit both our suit cases in to the lift with us. reception and bar area are laughable they are so small. room unbelively small. yes room clean but carpets stained and general appearance old, run down and in major need of a revamp. staff were friendly and helpful. breckfast was good. location good however overall terrible hotel and would definately not reccomend it. also we were facing to street. it very loud on saturday night and could not sleep with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: wanderer087
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night and was quite pleased with the hotel. Its located in a quiet street just off the Ku'damm which makes it very convenient if you're interested in walking down the main shopping areas. There is an S-bahn station also thats only about 10 min walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly, cheerful and polite. My luggage had been misplaced on the flight and hence I had virtually nothing on me but the reception provided all the toileteries I needed, and coordinated with the airline to send the luggage to the next location I was going to. Rooms are very small but had all the amenities you would typically expect in a holiday inn. My room had a lousy view as it looked out into a parking lot/garage. The breakfast was fantastic ! Its a buffet served on the top floor with large windows looking out onto the street below that makes it feel bright and cheery in the morning. The breakfast has a wide variety of hot and cold items. All in all, a nice place if you want to be on the Ku'damm, would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem outside the main hustle and bustle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Best_Gillybear
Reviews.Content: A 20 minute (2 Euros) bus ride (no. 109) from Tagel airport brings you within 100 yards of the hotel. Set off the main shopping street but a short walk to some lovely restaurants (try Ali Baba's, approx 400 yards up towards the subway on the right hand side) and approx 500 yards from the subway with good connections all over the city at a single route cost of 2.10 Euros. Small entrance but great reception staff. Rooms are fine, bed very very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent value and service was good too. Definitely recommend at the price. We paid 90 Euro B&B for a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, centrally located but worn in”
Reviews.Author: algray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and offers reasonable rates for tourists, but the hotel is slightly dated. Expect a comfortable, quiet stay but not the latest comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Smiler125
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be good value (75 Euro a night twin room), clean and in a good location. Get the S9 train Schönefeld Airport to Savignyplatz and it's a 5 min walk from there or the walk from the zoo train station is probably 15mins, but easy to jump on a bus instead. The staff were helpful and friendly, but I did not eat breakfast there as 15 Euro was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convnient Location, Decent Facilities, Excellent Price Point”
Reviews.Author: LyonZ
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent -- Bus 109 from Tegel airport takes you write to Bleibtreustrasse (bus stop is about 100 m from hotel) for EUR2.10. Lobby is sparse, but the staff is friendly and helpful. Some excellent sightseeing maps with shop lists are available. Rooms are not luxurious, but enough. Large bathtub, comfortable bed, and large writing desk and safe. CNN and BBC on the TV. Complimentary bottled water each day (nice to use for hot tea, if you bring your own hot water heater) and treats. Thick hotel curtains keep out sunlight. As others have noted, elevator is small and narrow but about par for European hotels. Felt safe in this hotel. Location is perfect. From Kurfurstendamm (main street; simliar to Champs Elysees in Paris) you can walk to an endless array of shops. Not far from this main street is a Kaiser's supermarket (open until 10AM; excellent salads and cold cuts if you opt out of the hotel breakfast). Further down are restaurants, antique shops, and the Savignyplatz S Bahn which you can use for day trips to Potsdam (S7) or commuting through central Berlin. If you want to be closer to museums (Potsdammer Platz) or prefer the nightlife near the main stations (Alexanderplatz, Zoo), then this may be slightly out of the way. However, it's a nice area, off the main drag. If you can get a rate for under EUR 80 you are probably in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: BCtraveler44
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. Small rooms, decent service. The hotel did not know where a laundry was but they reminded us they did have a service. 5 Euros for underwear. There was a laundry around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrandonTraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay. Taxi from Tegel Airport was 17euro, although the bus no 109 is only 2.10euro per person (you need the correct change) The airport bus stops at the end of the road. We arrived at 11am and was told a room was ready! Wow !Check in time is 2pm, so a real bonus to unpack and get straight out sightseeing. Very helpful reception staff, the lift is a bit small but works fine. Room was perfectly ok , air con worked a dream as it was 30c on arrival. TV gets CNN and BBC World Service and all of the local channels. Bathroom, ok not the biggest but had a bathtub and shower. Breakfast, very good. 0630-1030. Extended continental spread with hot food as well. The scrambled egg, bacon and sausages were very good. Room service available. Hotel is located on a busy side street off K Dam, with the hop on hop off tour buses just up the road. Its in a very safe, up market area. Hotel has a small bar, next to reception. The hotel is officially 4 star, and has the German Tourist badge saying so by the entrance, but i must admit many would only rate it as 3 star for its comforts. But its location, and the very helpful staff do indeed make this a four star option, without paying the much higher prices demanded by other hotels nearby. We would certainly use this hotel again, we had a lovely city break here. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel for singles/couples.”
Reviews.Author: jonatey
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a wonderful place to stay. We really enjoyed our 5 days there. We regularly stay in European cities for pleasure but this was our first time in Berlin. We don't stay in hotels too much and try to get to see as mmuch of a city as possible so we were looking for a cheap mid range hotel. The Holiday Inn in Kurfurstendam was a lovely hotel. Not a top range one so don't expect too much but the rooms were modern and clean although a little on the small side. The bathrooms were recently updated so very clean and modern. It was quite noisy being on the main street as the windows are not double glazed and very thin so you could hear the bin men in the morning amongst other traffic which was quite loud. Also the room was very hot as we went in the winter so heating was on but you could not manually turn it off or even down. We had to open a window to cool the room. No safe in the room but you could use the hotel one for no extra charge. Your immediate impression as you enter the lobby is that its very small. The bar area is just 2 chairs and a desk but the staff are very helpful and friendly and we even had a chance to practise our German with them which they were more than happy to help us with. Like I say this is a good quality hotel if you won't be permanently in you hotel room throughout your holiday. Not ideal for families in my opinion. More for couples/singles who are sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stuart462
Reviews.Content: It's the location that makes staying here a winner; it's on Bleibtraustrasse which has lots of very nice restaurants and leads up to the Savignyplatz area which also has loads. Of course, it's near the Ku'damm too with its shops. Public transport is excellent, e.g.the bus from Tegel airport stops at the top of the road. My room was fine, clean and sufficiently equipped with very efficient air con. Breakfast was standard Holiday Inn. Top Tip! Look up in the entrance lobby, the mirror's fab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Good servicable hotel”
Reviews.Author: P&AEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 teenage boys) stayed during a short break in February. The hotel was clean and reasonably well appointed and good value. It looked as if some areas were being redecorated but this didn't cause us any problems. Breakfast was a standard continental buffet in an airy room on the top floor. Again nothing special, but good coffee and a good selection of rolls, cereals and meats. Could have offered a wider chice of fresh fruit. Unlike other reviews, we found the staff friendly and helpful. Being able tospeak to them in even rudimentary German helped, I'm sure, even if their English was good. Location is great for public transport and a good selection of restaurants. A nice up market sort of neighbouhood where we felt quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Only Positive Thing Is Location”
Reviews.Author: mastermc54
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed at this place was because I got a decent rate through Priceline. After over 30 stays in the past with Priceline without a problem, this was the first time I felt like I was stuck in a 2nd rate room. The entire room smelled horribly of smoke and the staff seemed indifferent when I requested a non-smoking room. Even as a Priority Club Member with Platinum status, I wasn't expecting any sort of upgrade, but they couldn't even accomodate a room type request. They had the keys set aside before check-in and didn't seem to want to go through the hassle of changing anything. Not to be sexist, but I agree with other reviews of the female staff not being helpful or personable. They seemed to be sitting around and not doing work most of the time, while the only guy I saw during my stay seemed to be doing all the work. Otherwise, the location is great for access to the shopping area and restaurants. It's less than a 10 minute walk to the Zoo Garten train station, the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church, and there was even a nice Hard Rock Cafe a few streets down.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: smast
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location as is it near the ku,dam one of Berlins main shopping streets, Room was dirty and tired with a small bathroom, on checking out they tried to charge me 12. euro for a movie i did not watch as i was out of the room at the time!!, I left a shirt in the wardrobe of the room and upon going back to collect it the next day i was told it was not there and couldnt be found, the Female manager was very rude and intollerant., i was going to stay a week and left after the first night, i was also charged 10.00 euro extra for having 2 people in the room. never again

Reviews.Title: “go for shopping & sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: Bus stop just 2mins walk, hight street is 1 min. the female staffs were rude and not helpfull. tehy even tried to charge more than it should be. Asked about where to eat German food and was told do not know, no german restaruants in the area. then the male staffs told us a very cheap and nice restaurant in 3 mins walk. breakfast had not much choices. dirty cups and plates.

Reviews.Title: “good stuff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't think of a single bad thing to say about this place. Rooms were perfect, staff was friendly, location great. And we got our room in the middle of summer for much cheaper than the price listed here only booking a week ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Well located - great for a shopping trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - just off one of the main shopping strips in the city. Air con has been installed in all the rooms and there is even complimentary fresh fruit in the room to welcome you! One word of warning though - be careful with the pay-per-view movies - there is no infomation on screen informing the viewer that the film you may have flicked onto is chargeable......e12.50 for 3 minutes.......!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Neil99
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel to suit both business visitors and tourists. Clean and well appointed rooms, friendly staff and a great location with easy access to the buses and underground. Located in a quiet side street in what seems a safe and pleasant area. Air conditioning has now been fitted - temperature etc. being set via remote control - which is a real benefit as Berlin can get very hot. Breakfast buffet is good (13 Euro if not included in the room price, you can easily eat enough to be able to skip lunch) Good value for money and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a street just off the Kurfürstendamm and close to the station Zoologischer Garten, a great location. The hotel is clean and pleasant, the rooms big enough with a clean bathroom and the staff is very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was excellent. On the Kurfürstendamm, very close to the hotel, you can take the Berlin hop on hop off tour. Also the Berlin musical theatre Theater des Westens is within walking distance of the hotel. The only minor thing is that there is not a very big choice of restaurants very close to the hotel, but we cannot blame the Holiday Inn Garten Court for that. A great choice for your stay in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there July 9. Clean but small rooms, friendly staff, but no A/C. Windows open to the street or to a parking garage, so there is noise... They have a (or two?) non-smoking floor(s) and the breakfast room is non-smoking. Good location, half a block from the Ku'dam, and 7 blocks away from ZOO Station. I would return there, but I would definitevely ask for a top-floor room!

Reviews.Title: “only location is good”
Reviews.Author: paul_nl
Reviews.Content: Small, old hotel only the location is good. The staff is very rude, the rooms are small and dirty, the corridors make you feel unsafe, théy are small, dirty, dark and have paint coming out everywhere. This hotel is not worth the money, better spent a few euro's more and stay at the Crown Plaze or any of the golden tulip hotel. This kind of hotels give holiday-inn a bad reputation

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Garden Court Berlin - Kurfurstendam
HotelInfo.Address: Bleibtreustrasse 25, 10707 Berlin, Germany
